oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from JCRS to Mrs. Roisner
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (U.S.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Roisner, S.--Mrs.
Gleeman, Jacob--Mr.
Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (U.S.)
Patient Records
Letters
Denver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed letter from JCRS to Mrs. S. Roisner. The letter states that they will not be able to accept Mr. Gleeman immedately into the Sanatorium the way she requested because none of the current patients are expected to be able to leave in the near future. The letter reminds Mrs. Roisner that the Sanatorium was only opened two years ago and while their financial situation is better they are still limited in the number of patients they can admit. The letter advises Mrs. Roisner to send Mr. Gleeman to Denver if the climate is going to help his health but tells her that he needs to be provided sufficient funds for his room and board until such time he is able to be accepted into the Sanatorium. The letter is not signed but "Secretary" is typed at the bottom.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society Records, Patient Records

The letter continues to state the Sanatorium usually has a waiting list for admission and therefore they can not admitt patients upon their arrival to Denver espeically when they do not know the patient is coming.
